meanings.definition: A shrub with small white flowers and dark green leaves.
meanings.sent1: The privet in the garden attracts butterflies.
meanings.sent2: I planted a privet in my backyard for privacy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid nuts in the privet bush.
meanings.sent4: The privet stood tall like a guardian in the yard.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the privet filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: To trim or shape with privet hedges.
meanings.sent1: I will privet the bushes along the fence this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys priveting the shrubs to keep them neat.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors were surprised to see him priveting the garden at midnight.
meanings.sent4: She priveted the hedge into the shape of a heart for Valentine's Day.
meanings.sent5: The landscaper skillfully priveted the bushes into animal shapes.
